Property.name: Restrictions
Property.val: Please refer to the cancer protocol cover page (www.cap.org/cancerprotocols) for information about which tumor types and procedures can be reported using this template.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_43301
DisplayedItem.title: For information about lymph node sampling, please refer to the Regional Lymph Node section.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_31053
DisplayedItem.title: # Low-grade endometrial stromal sarcoma is distinguished from benign endometrial stromal nodule by depth of myometrial invasion greater than or equal to 3 mm, lymphovascular invasion, or greater than or equal to 3 foci of myometrial invasion of any depth. Minor marginal irregularity in the form of tongues less than 3 mm is allowable for an endometrial stromal nodule. This checklist does not apply to endometrial stromal nodules.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_58750
DisplayedItem.title: Required only for adenosarcoma. Adenosarcoma with sarcomatous overgrowth is usually high grade and should be considered high grade because of a poorer prognosis.

DisplayedItem.name: DI_43020
DisplayedItem.title: # Any organ not selected is either not involved or was not submitted.

Question.name: Q_350670
Question.title: Distance from Sarcoma to Closest Margin

DisplayedItem.name: DI_59259
DisplayedItem.title: # Lymph nodes designated as pelvic, parametrial, obturator, internal iliac (hypogastric), external iliac, common iliac, sacral, presacral, and para-aortic are considered regional lymph nodes. Any other involved nodes should be categorized as metastases (pM1) and commented on in the distant metastasis section. Presence of isolated tumor cells no greater than 0.2 mm in regional lymph node(s) is considered N0 (i+).

ListItem.name: LI_39548
ListItem.title: Not applicable (no regional lymph nodes submitted or found)

ListItem.name: LI_52407
ListItem.title: All regional lymph nodes negative for tumor

ListItem.name: LI_56735
ListItem.title: Tumor present in regional lymph node(s)

Question.name: Q_45889
Question.title: Number of Lymph Nodes with Tumor

Question.name: Q_705967
Question.title: ?Number of Lymph Nodes with Isolated Tumor Cells# (0.2 mm or less)

Property.name: p_rptTxt_705967_1
Property.val: Number of Lymph Nodes with Isolated Tumor Cells

DisplayedItem.name: DI_546515
DisplayedItem.title: # Reporting the number of lymph nodes with isolated tumor cells is required only in the absence of macrometastasis or micrometastasis in other lymph nodes.

Section.name: S_31244
Section.title: PATHOLOGIC STAGE CLASSIFICATION (pTNM, AJCC 8th ed.) (Note C)

DisplayedItem.name: DI_41538
DisplayedItem.title: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.

Property.name: p_rptTxt_41538_1
Property.val: Reporting of pT, pN, and (when applicable) pM categories is based on information available to the pathologist at the time the report is issued. As per the AJCC (Chapter 1, 8th Ed.) it is the managing physician’s responsibility to establish the final pathologic stage based upon all pertinent information, including but potentially not limited to this pathology report.
